org.lightsleep.database

Interface Database

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    db2, Db2, mariadb, MariaDB, mysql, MySQL, oracle, Oracle, postgresql, PostgreSQL, sqlite, SQLite, sqlserver, SQLServer, Standard

    public interface Database
    An interface to generate SQLs.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Masato Kokubo

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • supportsOffsetLimit

        default boolean supportsOffsetLimit()
        Returns whether support OFFSET and LIMIT in the SELECT SQL.
        Returns:
        true if support OFFSET and LIMIT, false otherwise

      • selectSql

        <E> java.lang.CharSequence selectSql(Sql<E> sql,
                                     java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Creates and returns a SELECT SQL.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the entity
        Parameters:
        sql - the Sql object that contains SQL generation information that contains SQL generation information
        parameters - the list to add the parameters of the SQL
        Returns:
        a CharSequence including SELECT SQL
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if SELECT SQL without columns was generated

      • subSelectSql

        <E,OE> java.lang.CharSequence subSelectSql(Sql<E> sql,
                                           Sql<OE> outerSql,
                                           java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Creates and returns a SELECT SQL excluding OFFSET/LIMIT, FOR UPDATE and ORDER BY.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the entity
        OE - the type of the entity of outerSql
        Parameters:
        sql - the Sql object that contains SQL generation information
        outerSql - the Sql object syntactically outer of sql
        parameters - the list to add the parameters of the SQL
        Returns:
        a CharSequence including SELECT SQL
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if SELECT SQL without columns was generated

      • subSelectSql

        <E,OE> java.lang.CharSequence subSelectSql(Sql<E> sql,
                                           Sql<OE> outerSql,
                                           java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.CharSequence> columnsSupplier,
                                           java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Creates and returns a SELECT SQL excluding OFFSET/LIMIT, FOR UPDATE and ORDER BY.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the entity
        OE - the type of the entity of outerSql
        Parameters:
        sql - the Sql object that contains SQL generation information
        outerSql - the Sql object syntactically outer of sql
        columnsSupplier - a Supplier of the columns string
        parameters - the list to add the parameters of the SQL
        Returns:
        a CharSequence including SELECT SQL

        <T> T convert(java.lang.Object value,
              java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Converts the object to the specified type.

      • maskPassword

        default java.lang.String maskPassword(java.lang.String jdbcUrl)
        Masks the password of the JDBC URL.
        Parameters:
        jdbcUrl - a JDBC URL
        Returns:
        the JDBC URL masked the password
        Since:
        2.2.0

      • getObject

        default java.lang.Object getObject(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                   java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
                                   java.lang.String columnLabel)
        Gets the value from the resultSet and returns it.
        Parameters:
        connection - the Connection object
        resultSet - the ResultSet object
        columnLabel - the label for the column
        Returns:
        the column value
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connection, resultSet or columnLabel is null
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database, replaces it with this exception
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • getInstance

        static Database getInstance(java.lang.String jdbcUrl)
        Returns a database handler related to jdbcUrl.
        Parameters:
        jdbcUrl - a JDBC URL
        Returns:
        the database handler related to the JDBC URL
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if jdbcUrl does not contain a string that can identify a Database class
        Since:
        2.1.0
